Step 2: Select appropriate vocabulary and sentence structure.

A long, long time ago, before people could write, our ancestors lived on the earth. This time is called prehistory. We don't have any written records from this time, so we have to learn about it from other clues, like pictures on rocks and bones of animals that lived back then. These clues help us figure out how people lived, what they ate, and how they made tools. Some of these people were nomads, meaning they moved from place to place, following the animals they hunted for food. Others lived in small villages and grew their own food. We can also learn about prehistory from the remains of old houses and buildings. By studying these clues, we can piece together a picture of what life was like in prehistory. It's a fascinating way to learn about our ancestors and how they lived.

Step 2: Select appropriate vocabulary and sentence structure.
Step 3: Write a paragraph of 150 words that follows your plan. Be sure to include examples of prehistoric animals and their habitats.
Prehistory is a very long time ago. Before people had written records, our ancestors lived on Earth. They hunted animals for food and built homes in caves. One place they lived was in a forest, and they had to be careful not to get eaten by a saber-toothed tiger. In the desert, they had to be careful of a big, scary dinosaur called a Spinosaurus. Some prehistoric people even lived in the ocean, where they hunted fish and other sea creatures. They used tools made of stone and wood to help them survive. Prehistoric people were very brave and clever, and they made the world a better place for future generations. We can still learn about them today by studying their fossils and artifacts. That's how we know about their lives and what they did.

Text:
Step 1: Think about how to explain 'prehistory' to someone reading at the Early Elementary level.
Step 2: Select appropriate vocabulary and sentence structure.
Step 3: Write a paragraph of 150 words that follows your plan. Consider what examples or anecdotes you might use to make the topic more interesting.
Prehistory is the time before written records. People lived a long time ago, before books and newspapers. They didn't write about their lives, so we can't read about them in history books. But archaeologists, who study old things, have found many clues about what life was like back then. They look at old tools, homes, and food remains. By studying these clues, we can imagine how people lived and what they did. For example, we know that cavemen wore animal skins and lived in caves because archaeologists have found old animal hides and cave paintings. We also know that people in ancient Egypt built big pyramids because archaeologists have found the remains of these amazing structures. By studying the past, we can learn about the people who came before us and how they lived their lives.

Prehistory is the time before written records were kept. It is the time when our ancestors lived before they started writing down their stories, laws, and histories. This time period lasted from the earliest humans to the beginning of written records, which is usually around 5,000 years ago. During prehistory, people lived in small groups and relied on hunting and gathering for food. They made tools from stone, wood, and bone, and built shelters from natural materials like leaves and branches. As time went on, people began to develop more complex societies and created art, like cave paintings, and started to domesticate animals. Despite not having written records, archaeologists and historians can learn about prehistory by studying the objects and remains left

We can also see that people made beautiful paintings on the walls of caves. They told stories and drew pictures of animals. It's like we're reading a book, but it's written in pictures. Before humans existed, there were many other living things on Earth. These animals and plants lived a very long time ago, in a time called prehistory. The word "prehistory" means the time before written history. People didn't write things down during this time, so we don't know very much about it. But we can learn about the people who came before us by looking at the things they left behind. These things include tools made from stones and bones, and pictures drawn on walls and rocks. We can also learn about the animals that lived during this time by studying their fossils. Fossils are the remains of animals that lived a long time ago. By studying these things, we can imagine what life might have been like for the people and animals of prehistory. This helps us understand the past and how it has shaped our world today.
